Academics Home / Explore Programs / French

French

Degree

BA in World Languages and Linguistics

School

Humanities and Social Sciences

Department

World Languages and Cultures

At a Glance

Study global languages, cultures, and literature to better understand our multicultural world and open doors to diverse career opportunities. Mastery of a language like French is a highly valued skill that applies to nearly any industry. The French specialization within the world languages and linguistics major provides a strong foundation in linguistics and language acquisition along with in-depth French language study. You’ll graduate with a liberal arts education and gain immersive cultural experiences, including study abroad, that will prepare you for a global career.

ApplyRequest Info

Undergraduate Program Options

MAJOR

French Specialization
within world languages and linguistics

MINOR

French Minor

CERTIFICATE

French for Business

You’ll Benefit From:

  • An innovative program in world languages and linguistics that’s unique to TCNJ
  • Small class sizes, individual attention, and extensive use of the target language
  • Immersive cultural experiences like trips, speakers, festivals, and performances
  • A weekly oral-proficiency hour for small-group practice in a relaxed atmosphere
  • Participation in community-engaged activities assisting non-English speakers
  • First-rate instruction and strong mentorship from expert faculty
  • Study abroad opportunities available at more than 100 locations
  • A flexible curriculum that easily accommodates double majors or additional minors

Careers

You’ll graduate with the skills, insights, and experiences that appeal to both top employers and graduate schools. Knowledge of other languages and cultures can significantly enhance your career opportunities in any field, including business, education, law, medicine, healthcare, international education, nonprofit, government, technology, marketing, social services, and more. You will also be well-prepared to pursue graduate school at top institutions.

Course Sequence

The major assumes no previous foreign-language study. Even if you enter with no knowledge of a foreign language, you will have ample time to complete the required seven language courses and five linguistics courses. If you enter the program at a higher proficiency level, you can take a more significant number of upper-level courses in the foreign language. You will be actively encouraged to complete at least one study abroad semester and can take three language and linguistics courses for the major and one free elective during your semester abroad.

Study Abroad 

Study abroad is integral to this program to ensure you gain global experience and perspective through immersion in other languages and cultures. You may choose a credit-bearing program offered by TCNJ or one of many third-party programs provided through TCNJ’s Arlotto Family Center for Global Engagement.

Student Organizations 

Maximize your experience at TCNJ through the many student-led organizations on campus that offer additional exposure to languages and cultures of interest. The department supports and participates in the Chinese Students Association, French Club, German Club, Italian Club, Japanese Student Association, and the Spanish Club.

Faculty

Students are guided and instructed by dedicated world languages and linguistics faculty from diverse cultural backgrounds. Faculty members represent more than 10 countries and speak Arabic, Chinese, Danish, English, French, German, Italian, Hebrew, Japanese, Polish, Russian, Spanish, and Yiddish.
